localization.SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.Title: Wizard Spellbook Management
localization.SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.Descript: Master wizard-specific features including spell learning, copying from scrolls, and spellbook management
Wizards have unique spellcasting mechanics that SpellBook handles automatically:

• Maintain a spellbook of known spells
• Learn new spells when you level up
• Copy spells from scrolls and other spellbooks
• Prepare a subset of known spells each day
• Track gold and time costs for spell copying

This tour will guide you through all wizard-specific features in SpellBook!
localization.SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.Tab.Cont:
Wizards get a special "Wizard Spellbook" tab in addition to their class spell tab:

• **Class Tab**: Shows spells you've prepared and can cast
• **Wizard Spellbook Tab**: Shows ALL spells in your spellbook (prepared or not)

The spellbook icon differentiates this tab from your regular spell list. This is where you'll learn new spells and manage your growing collection!
localization.SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.KnownVsP:
Understanding the wizard spell system:

**Known Spells (Spellbook)**:
• All spells you've learned and written in your spellbook
• Visible in the Wizard Spellbook tab
• Can grow to hundreds of spells over your career

**Prepared Spells**:
• Subset of known spells you've prepared for the day
• Limited to Intelligence modifier + Wizard level
• Visible in your Class tab with checkboxes

Think of your spellbook as a library, and prepared spells as the books you're carrying today.
This tracker shows your spellbook status:

• **Total Spells**: Current number of spells in your spellbook
• **Free Spells Remaining**: How many more spells you can learn from leveling
• **Maximum Capacity**: Theoretical limit (usually unlimited)

When you level up, you automatically get 2 free spell slots to add spells to your spellbook. Any additional spells must be learned through copying.
localization.SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.Learning:
Click the "Learn Spell" button on any spell to add it to your spellbook:

**Free Learning** (from leveling):
• Available when you have free spell slots from leveling
• No gold cost or time required
• Typically 2 spells per level

**Paid Learning** (copying):
• Costs 50 gp per spell level
• Takes 2 hours per spell level
• Can be used anytime if you have gold

SpellBook automatically deducts gold from your character sheet (if you have module settings enabled).
localization.SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.Costs.Co:
When copying spells, the costs are:

**Gold Cost**: 50 gp × spell level
• 1st level: 50 gp
• 2nd level: 100 gp
• 3rd level: 150 gp
• And so on up to 9th level (450 gp)

**Time Cost**: 2 hours × spell level
• Represents deciphering magical notation
• Writing it in your own spellbook
• Practicing the spell's components

Cantrips (0-level) are free but still require time to transcribe.
localization.SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.FreeSpel:
SpellBook tracks which spells were learned for free:

• **Level-Up Spells**: Spells learned when you leveled (shows as "Free")
• **Initial Spells**: Starting spells from 1st level (shows as "Initial")
• **Copied Spells**: Spells you paid gold to learn (shows as "Copied")
• **Scroll Spells**: Spells learned from scrolls (shows as "Scroll")

This helps you track your spellbook's history and ensures you're using your free spells appropriately. Wizards get strategic advantages by choosing their free spells wisely!
When you have spell scrolls in your inventory, special buttons appear:

• Scrolls are automatically detected in your character's items
• Click "Learn from Scroll" to add the spell to your spellbook
• The scroll is consumed (if settings allow)
• Gold cost is still required (represents material components)
• Learning from scrolls still counts as "copied" not "free"

Finding scrolls is a great way for wizards to expand their spellbook beyond their class spell list!
Wizard spell schools are especially important:

• **Wizard Subclass Schools**: Some wizard subclasses specialize in specific schools
• **Savant Features**: Some features reduce gold/time costs for your specialized school
• **Prohibited Schools**: Some subclasses prohibit certain schools

Use the school filter to quickly find spells in your specialized school, or to avoid prohibited schools. SpellBook respects school-based cost reductions automatically!
localization.SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.Preparin:
To prepare spells for the day:

1. Go to your **Class Tab** (not the Spellbook tab)
2. Check the boxes next to spells you want to prepare
3. Stay within your preparation limit (Int mod + Wizard level)
4. Click **Save** to commit your preparation

You can only prepare spells that are already in your spellbook (in the Wizard Spellbook tab). After a long rest, you can change your prepared spells by selecting different spells from your spellbook.
localization.SPELLBOOK.Tours.WizardSpellbook.Strategi:
Maximize your wizard's potential:

• **Use free spells wisely**: Choose expensive high-level spells when leveling
• **Collect scrolls**: Scrolls are cheaper than transcribing from spellbooks
• **Diversify early**: Build a broad spellbook at low levels
• **Ritual spells**: Learn ritual spells so you don't have to prepare them
• **School focus**: If you specialize, learn those spells via copying (cheaper)
• **Campaign prep**: Learn spells that match your campaign's themes
• **Trade with wizards**: Offer to copy from each other's spellbooks

A wizard's spellbook is their greatest treasure. Build it wisely, and you'll be prepared for any situation!
